intro: Panicum autumnale var. pubiflorum, commonly known as purpletop millet, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and panicles of purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in moist to wet soils in wetlands and along stream banks. It is an important species for both ecological and agricultural purposes due to its ability to thrive in wet conditions. The variety pubiflorum is distinguished by its hairy flower clusters, which give it a distinctive appearance.
